comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
I presumed that `$~document` would result in these two outcomes simultaneously:
• No warning prompt when visiting a site in AdGuard's normal filtering mode (Pretty much the same behaviour as before).
• The entry would not be applied at all in DNS filtering mode, which would be a good thing in this case.

comment.body:
@sparky672 Hi. Please try this:

> Follow the steps below to fully uninstall AdGuard for Safari: 
> 1. Uncheck all AdGuard for Safari extensions in **Safari -> Preferences -> Extensions** (if available)
> 2. Open **Finder** and press Shift+Command+G
>     - Remove AdGuardSafariApp folder from **~/Library/Application Support** directory
>     - Remove from **~/Library/Containers** - all directories started with AdGuard-
>     - Remove TC3Q7MAJXF.com.adguard.safari.AdGuard folder from **~/Library/GroupContainers** directory
>     - Remove com.adguard.safari.AdGuard.plist from **~/Library/Preferences** 
> 3. Open **Activity Monitor** and force quit all "cfprefsd" processes 
> 4. Remove AdGuard for Safari from **Applications**

If no result - please write to support@adguard.com or open an issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues

This issue is not related to filters, so closed here.
